antichess.viewgui
Class ChessBoardView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      antichess.viewgui.ChessBoardView
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardObserver, BoardView, KeyListener, MouseListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener
public class ChessBoardView
extends Component
implements BoardView, MouseListener, BoardObserver, KeyListener

ChessBoardView is the graphic representation of a Board for use in the view. ChessBoardView extends the abstract class BoardView. The ChessBoardView draws the viewedBoard and allows the user to input moves when requested. When setAcceptingInput is called the Board processes the users mouse clicks and reports a click from a square containing a piece for the HumanPlayer specified in the parameters to setAcceptingInput to a destination square. Determining if this is a valid move is the responsibility of that HumanPlayer. setNotAcceptingInput cancels out a setAcceptingInput. A ChessBoardView requires that imageMap contain the following images: RAntiking RBishop RKing RKnight RPawn RQueen RRook WAntiking WBishop WKing WKnight WPawn WQueen WRook board

Author:
nlharr
See Also:
Serialized Form
Specification Fields
  • acceptingInput //boolean that determines which state we are in
  • startLocation //Stores the value of the start location on the board //for the user inputed move
  • endLocation //Stores the value of the end location on the board //for the user inputed move
  • boardPlayer //stores the human player the BoardView is updates information to
  • viewedBoard //the ChessBoard that this ChessGUI is displaying
  • showPiecesWithMoves //boolean
  • showPossibleMoves //boolean that determines whether squares are drawn over possible moves
  • showLastMoves //boolean that determines whether a square highlighting the last move is shown
  • discoMode //boolean storing if we are in disco mode
  • imageMap //ImageMap
  • showKitty //boolean that determines whether we show an image of a kitty

Constructor Detail

ChessBoardView

public ChessBoardView(ChessBoard board,
                      ImageMap imageMap,
                      int boardXOffset,
                      int boardYOffset,
                      int boardWidth,
                      int boardHeight)
Constructor that creates a new ChessBoardView

Requires:
board != null, imageMap != null boardXOffset >= 0, boardYOffset >= 0, boardWidth > 0, boardHeight>0 imageMap maps these strings to non null values: Rantiking RBishop RKing RKnight RPawn RQueen RRook WAntiking WBishop WKing WKnight WPawn WQueen WRook board board is the board this BoardView focuses imageMap is the imageMap it uses boardXOffset specifies how many pixels from the right the board in imageMap.getImage("board") begins. boardYOffset specifies how many pixels from the top the board in imageMap.getImage("board") begins. boardWidth specifies how many pixels in the x direction the board in imageMap.getImage("board") occupies. boardHeight specifies how many pixels in the y direction the board in imageMap.getImage("board") occupies. showPossibleMoves starts out true discoMode starts out false showLastMoves starts out false

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e)
Specified by:
mousePressed in interface MouseListener
Effects:
If acceptingInput == true{ if the location clicked on contains a piece of else sets endLocation to the square that was clicked on calls postMove with the move generated from startLocation, and endLocation resets startLocation, resets endLocation
Modifies:
startLocation, endLocation

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
Specified by:
keyPressed in interface KeyListener
Effects:
if KeyEvent e is for the key 'SPACE' calls showPiecesWithMoves if KeyEvent e is for the key 'SPACE' calls showLasMoves() if KeyEvent e is for the key 'H' calls showKitty()

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
Specified by:
keyReleased in interface KeyListener
Effects:
if KeyEvent e is for the key 'SPACE' calls noShowPiecesWithMoves if KeyEvent e is for the key 'SPACE' calls noShowLasMoves() if KeyEvent e is for the key 'H' calls noShowKitty()
